CatDescriptText: Manuel Leibowitz, parking lot attendant, 609 Dawson Street and John L. Clark, retired, 2123 Wylie Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 16, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think the main issues will be, or should be, in the coming presidential campaign?" Mr. Leibowitz's answer reads: "The wage law ought to be a major issue.  Wages should be at least $1.25 an hour and there should be a 40-hour work law to give more people jobs.  The big unemployment problem is another issue.  "CCC camps should be started again to help keep the youths off the streets and reduce the crime rate."  Mr. Clark's answer reads: "There should be more civil rights and more voice for the NAACP."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Manuel Leibowitz wearing light colored uniform shirt with "System" patch, standing behind automobiles and brick building; Portrait of John L. Clark wearing light colored button down collared shirt and moustache, holding ice cream cone, standing in front of brick wall
